title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that South-West monsoon conditions are gradually becoming established over the island.

title: Sri Lanka marks 16 years since the end of civil war
byline: Today (18) marks 16 years since the end of Sri Lanka’s three-decade-long civil war, which concluded with the death of Velupillai Prabhakaran, leader of the armed separatist group – the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) – by Sri Lankan security forces at the Nandikadal Lagoon on May 18, 2009.

title: Railway station masters’ token strike concludes
byline: The token strike launched by the Railway Station Masters, based on several demands, concluded at midnight yesterday (17).

title: Mexican Navy ship crashes into New York City’s Brooklyn Bridge
byline: Nineteen people have been injured and four remain in a serious condition after a tall Mexican Navy training ship crashed into New York City’s Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Austria’s JJ wins Eurovision Song Contest as Israel comes 2nd
byline: Austrian singer JJ has won the Eurovision Song Contest in Basel, Switzerland, after a nail-biting finish that saw him topple Israel from pole position at the very last minute.

title: Sajith accuses govt. of burdening public with 18% electricity tariff hike
byline: The losses incurred by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) due to inefficient management should no longer be passed on to the general public, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has said.

title: South-west monsoon conditions gradually establishing; Warning issued for heavy rains
byline: An ‘Amber’ level advisory for heavy rains has been issued for the next 24 hours in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and the North-western provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya and Kandy districts valid for the next 24 hours.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in six districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in six districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Govt focused on creating a humane future generation that respects cultural diversity – PM Harini
byline: The main objective of the present government includes nurturing a future generation that is humane, environmentally conscious, respectful of Sri Lanka’s cultural diversity, and enriched with scholarly knowledge, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has said.

title: Indian national arrested with ‘Kush’ worth Rs. 41mn at KKS Port
byline: A stock of Kush cannabis, illegally brought into Sri Lanka by an Indian national aboard a passenger ship from India’s Nagapattinam to the Kankesanturai Port, has been seized by Sri Lanka Customs officers stationed at the Kankesanturai Port.

title: Health Minister departs for Switzerland
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has departed for Switzerland this morning (18).

title: Shooting of Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle: 4 police teams probing CCTV footage
byline: Four teams from the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) and the Narahenpita Police are examining CCTV footage in relation to the shooting of the vehicle of former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa in Narahenpita last night (17).

title: Sivakarthikeyan’s Madharasi team shifts to Sri Lanka for climax shoot
byline: Sivakarthikeyan’s 23rd film Madharasi has been progressing at a brisk pace. Directed by AR Murugadoss and produced by Sri Lakshmi movies, the release date of the film has been finalised for September 5 this year.

title: Proposed electricity tariff revision still lower than early 2024 rates, CEB claims
byline: Although electricity tariffs are expected to rise under the proposed new revision, the rates will still be lower than those at the beginning of this year (2025), according to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: Proposed electricity tariffs still lower than early 2024 rates, CEB claims
byline: Although electricity tariffs are expected to rise under the proposed new revision, the rates will still be lower than those at the beginning of this year (2025), according to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: Pope Leo XIV holds inaugural Mass at St Peter’s Square in front of thousands
byline: Pope Leo XIV rode into St. Peter’s Square on a popemobile for the first time on Sunday as tens of thousands of people, including dozens of world leaders, celebrated him as the new leader of the world’s 1.4. billion Catholics.

title: Microsoft says it provided AI to Israeli military for war but denies use to harm people in Gaza
byline: Microsoft acknowledged Thursday that it sold advanced artificial intelligence and cloud computing services to the Israeli military during the war in Gaza and aided in efforts to locate and rescue Israeli hostages.

title: Ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa issues special statement to mark 16 years since war victory
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has issued a special statement to mark the 16th year anniversary since the defeat of LTTE terrorism that plagued Sri Lanka for over three decades.

title: National War Heroes’ Day celebrations under President’s patronage
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to participate in the National War Heroes’ Day celebrations to be held tomorrow (19), in commemoration of the 16th anniversary of the war victory, according to the Ranaviru Seva Authority.

title: UK Foreign Office in contact with SL authorities following arrest of British woman with narcotics
byline: The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) of the United Kingdom is reportedly in contact with local authorities following the arrest of a 21-year-old British national for the possession of narcotics on May 12.

title: Sri Lanka looks to deepen ties with China in energy sector: Minister
byline: Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody has reaffirmed Sri Lanka’s commitment to expanding the energy partnership with China, describing China as a “close friend” and outlining ambitious plans for collaboration across petroleum and renewable energy projects.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: Heavy showers above 100 mm can be expected at some places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya and Kandy districts due to the impact of the South-West monsoon conditions, the Department of Meteorology has warned.

title: One person injured in Bloemendhal Road shooting
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported along the Bloemendhal Road in Colombo 13, Police said.

title: Special traffic plan in Battaramulla tomorrow due to War Heroes’ Commemoration
byline: A special traffic plan will be in place tomorrow (19) around the Parliament area in Battaramulla due to the National War Heroes’ Day celebrations.

title: Over 15% Sri Lankans lost their jobs due to economic crisis, new data suggests
byline: A total of 15.1% of Sri Lankans lost their jobs due to the impact of the economic crisis in 2023, according to the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Elton John condemns UK’s AI copyright plans
byline: Elton John on Sunday accused the British government of “committing theft” by proposing that tech firms could train artificial intelligence models on the UK’s music and creative output without guaranteeing proper recompense.

title: Israel airstrikes kill at least 130 in Gaza as negotiators seek ceasefire
byline: Israeli strikes killed at least 130 Palestinians across Gaza overnight, health officials said on Sunday, as Israel said talks with Hamas included a proposal to end the war but sources on both sides said there had been no progress in the talks.

title: Building fire kills 17, injures others in southern India
byline: At least 17 people were killed and several injured in a fire that broke out at a building near the historic Charminar monument in Hyderabad city, southern India, officials said Sunday.
